Package marketplace.Handlers

Class PasswordHandler

java.lang.Object
marketplace.Handlers.PasswordHandler
public class PasswordHandler
extends java.lang.Object
Provides hashing functionality, creates strong passwords, checks strength of passwords. Provides all functionality for dealing with passwords.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    PasswordHandler()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String generatePassword()
    Generates a strong random password with 13-19 characters, picked from digits, letters and characters
    static java.lang.String IntoHash​(java.lang.String message)
    adds a salt to the input message and gets it's SHA-256 hash
    static boolean IsPasswordStrong​(java.lang.String password)
    Checks if a password is strong against previously declared standards
    static java.lang.String ToHexidecimalString​(byte[] hash)
    Helper method for IntoHash, turns byte array into hexadecimal REFERENCE: geeks for geeks article on "SHA-256 Hash in Java"

    • generatePassword

      public java.lang.String generatePassword()
      Generates a strong random password with 13-19 characters, picked from digits, letters and characters
      Returns:
      newPassword , a randomly generated strong password

    • IsPasswordStrong

      public static boolean IsPasswordStrong​(java.lang.String password)
      Checks if a password is strong against previously declared standards
      Parameters:
      password - , the password to be checked
      Returns:
      boolean of whether the input was a strong password or not

    • ToHexidecimalString

      public static java.lang.String ToHexidecimalString​(byte[] hash)
      Helper method for IntoHash, turns byte array into hexadecimal REFERENCE: geeks for geeks article on "SHA-256 Hash in Java"
      Parameters:
      hash - sha-256 encryption of input message, byte array
      Returns:
      hexString hexadecimal string of SHA-256 hash

    • IntoHash

      public static java.lang.String IntoHash​(java.lang.String message) throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      adds a salt to the input message and gets it's SHA-256 hash
      Parameters:
      message - string that is to be encrypted with SHA-256
      Returns:
      SHA256 hash of the message in a string
      Throws:
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if sha-256 algorithm can't be found
